prompt: Design a C++ function that, given a vector<int>, returns a new vector containing the unique elements in the same order.
Implement a C++ algorithm that finds the maximum-sum contiguous subsequence in an array of integers.
Create a C++ function that takes a string and returns its shortest form by removing consecutive duplicate characters.
Develop a C++ function that checks whether two binary trees are isomorphic in structure and value.
Write a C++ program that generates all anagrams of a given word without repetitions and prints them in lexicographic order.
Implement a C++ function that returns the sum of the digits of a number repeatedly until a single digit remains (digital root).
Write a C++ function that takes a number N and returns all prime numbers less than N using the Sieve of Eratosthenes.
Create a C++ class that represents an operation history with attributes (operation, time, result) and a function that filters by operation type and sorts by time.
Implement a C++ function that computes the median of an odd-sized vector<int> without fully sorting the vector.
Write a C++ program that reads two N×N square matrices and determines whether they are inverses of each other.
Create a C++ function that takes a number N and determines how many pairs (i, j) with i < j and 0 ≤ i, j < N satisfy that (i + j) is prime.
Implement a C++ function that converts a Roman numeral to an integer (assuming it is valid) and another function that performs the inverse conversion.
Write a C++ program that simulates a custom stack with push, pop, and top operations, using dynamic memory and handling underflow and overflow errors.
Create a C++ function that computes the least common multiple (LCM) of a list of numbers using an efficient algorithm based on the greatest common divisor (GCD).
Implement a C++ function that, given an undirected graph represented by an adjacency list and a source node, computes the shortest distances to all other nodes using Dijkstra's algorithm.
Write a C++ program that solves the subset sum problem, determining whether there exists a subset of a vector that sums to a given target value.
Create a C++ function that takes two strings and determines the Levenshtein distance between them, i.e., the minimum number of edits required to transform one into the other.
Implement a C++ function that takes an integer N and returns the number of distinct ways to climb N steps if you can climb 1, 2, or 3 steps at a time.
Write a C++ program that determines whether a vector of integers can be circularly rotated to become sorted in ascending order.
Create a C++ function that takes a string and returns the longest palindromic subsequence (not necessarily contiguous).
